text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen when I 
was writing the dessert chapter in my cookbook

one thing that I noticed very quickly was that 
in Thailand we do a lot of desserts soups and

which is so rare in Western deserts right so 
today I want to share with you a really easy
and delicious dessert soup called sakoo cantaloupe now Sakoo is tapioca pearls and cantaloupe is

cantaloupe and so I absolutely love this dessert 
and cantaloupe happens to be in season right now

in Vancouver so it's perfect perfect timing so 
let's get started so I'm gonna start by making

the broth of this soup and it's super easy I'm 
using three different liquids the first one is

coconut water I love using coconut water in really 
just about anything oh this is low delicious and

then you don't have to add as much sugar because 
there's natural sweetness in here and then for

a little richness coconut milk of course I don't 
think there's a Thai dessert that doesn't involve

coconut in some form now this dessert will often 
have milk as well so I am adding just whole milk

you can do skim or 1% 2% whatever you have at home 
if you want it a little bit lighter and if you see

it's high dessert that has milk in it chances are 
it's one of the newer ones because the old-school

ancient traditional recipes we never use dairy in 
any effect so it's sort of a relatively new thing

okay hand and leave now pennin leaves are used 
in many of my desserts it's sort of our version

of vanilla it has a beautiful floral a little bit 
coconutty aroma and we put it in like the majority

of our deserves it's optional here because the 
cantaloupe will have its own aroma but I think

it's just lovely to add it to the broth as 
well and you can get it frozen or fresh at

your Asian grocery store this recipe because 
it's a broth it's super flexible you can add

as much or as little sugar as you like so just 
add them taste and it also depends on how sweet

your coconut water is as well and also taste your 
cantaloupe before you make the broth because if

the cantaloupe is very sweet this doesn't have to 
be very sweet if it's not then you want to make it

up with the broth perfect so now I'm just going to 
bring this to a simmer to allow the aroma from the

pandan leaves to infuse and that's it that's the 
broth right there and then I'm just going to let

it cool completely because it's a cold dessert 
in the fridge now the tapioca so for this you

want small tapioca pearls okay and I'm using this 
rainbow color run but you can just use white or

whatever color you want now they come in a pack 
just like this and they're really cheap and it's

like a dollar 50 or something like that widely 
available at most Asian grocery stores so the

number one problem that people have with cooking 
tapioca pearls is that the pearls stick together

into a big mush and that's because the water is 
not fully boiling if the water is not on a full

boil the pearls was just sort of like dissolve 
into each other but if it's boiling like this

it'll just sort of seal the outside and that's 
how you prevent them from sticking together so

this is the most important thing you don't have 
to rinse it or wash your anything some people

like to do that I mean they're they're pretty 
clean in my opinion okay so I'm just gonna drop

them in and in the beginning I like to serve and 
really crank the heat because you want the water

to come back to a full boil as soon as possible 
there we go and you just put lots and lots of

water like you're making pasta they put lots 
of water and as long as the pearls are kind of

dancing in this boiling water they will not stick 
together and they will not stick to the bottom so

you don't have to stir it and so this will just 
take about 12 to 15 minutes so after about 12

minutes I'm going to fish them out into a bowl 
of cold water and what you're looking for is you

can still sort of see the middle bit of the white 
bits of the pearls but they're quite small by this

point and I'm going to just transfer them quickly 
into this bowl of water and that'll just stop them

from cooking any further and - it will wash off 
there's my timer yes thank you I've it'll wash

off any of the gooey tapioca starch that's loose 
in the pot as you can see the liquid now is really

quite gooey and I don't want any of that so I have 
a fine mesh skimmer that would be perfect for this

job but I forgot it so oh yeah this one's getting 
to be too big so I need this sieve to the rescue

alright so now I'm going to drain this into my sis 
now you could drain this directly but with this

tip that I have it would melt the food because 
it's a plastic sieve so I'm gonna run some cold

water over it just to make sure it's cold none 
that nothing is sticking together or rinse off

any excess starch and that is it so that's happy 
yoga's ready the broth is cooling now just one

more thing we are done and that is scooping melons 
so I've got here some nice ripe sweet cantaloupe

and some honeydew melon you can just do cantaloupe 
but you know two colors are nicer than one so I'm

gonna use my melon baller here and scoop out 
bite size scoop so I like smaller pieces so it

doesn't sort of overwhelm the tapioca so this 
melon baller came with my toolkit when I was a

culinary school student and I think the only thing 
I've ever used it for is when I make this dessert

otherwise just sits there somewhere in the corner 
okay I'm ready to serve go easy that was it always

surprises me how quick and easy this dessert is 
so a little bit of tapioca in the bottom of the

bowl and you can put as much or as little as 
you like you can you know make this more of a

drink if you want or you can make it more of a 
like a spooning kind of soup whatever you like

now the melon goes in now I personally prefer the 
cantaloupe so I always want to put like an extra

cantle have been compared to the honeydew melon 
but I just love the color of both all right and

now the broth which is now cool goes in now you 
don't want to put this together too far ahead of

time because it's happy oka will continue to 
absorb that bra okay so I would say put this

together when you're ready to eat or at the most 
within the hour of eating all right it's like a

little jewel give it a little stir to break up 
the tapioca a little bit I just love how fun and

cute this looks Oh smells so good mmm I love it 
I love the texture the tapioca sort of just rolls

around in your mouth I mean you can barely chew 
it it just kind of flips and slide in your mouth

really aromatic the combination of the cantaloupe 
smell from the pandan leaves the coconut milk with

coconut water it's light it's refreshing oh I 
can't think of a better thing to have on a hot

summer day or if you've had like a heavy dinner 
you just want something light something sweet and

light and the meal this is so perfect so I hope 
you give this a try and the recipe as a way to be

on top hi kitchen calm and when you make it send 
me a photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram oh I

forgot to tell you if you don't like canceler put 
mangoes in it really delicious as well and i'll

see you next time for your next delicious tiny 
and so this will just take about 12 to 15 minutes
you
